body_html:
my bad, I should have been more clear. I'm ran the same experiment on a 12G gpu and it crashed after a few days. In order to reproduce it, I re ran the code with gpu_options=tf.GPUOptions(per_process_gpu_memory_fraction=0.05)) which resulted in the logs above.

I'm not sure if I understand what you mean by full log. TensorFlow also outputs See logs for memory state., but it doesn't say where can I find it.
body_text:
my bad, I should have been more clear. I'm ran the same experiment on a 12G gpu and it crashed after a few days. In order to reproduce it, I re ran the code with gpu_options=tf.GPUOptions(per_process_gpu_memory_fraction=0.05)) which resulted in the logs above.
I'm not sure if I understand what you mean by full log. TensorFlow also outputs See logs for memory state., but it doesn't say where can I find it.
body:
my bad, I should have been more clear. I'm ran the same experiment on a 12G gpu and it crashed after a few days. In order to reproduce it, I re ran the code with `gpu_options=tf.GPUOptions(per_process_gpu_memory_fraction=0.05))` which resulted in the logs above.

I'm not sure if I understand what you mean by full log. TensorFlow also outputs `See logs for memory state.`, but it doesn't say where can I find it.
